queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

metadata.name={{release-name-onos-classic}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{onos-classic}}.volumeMounts.name={{probe-scripts}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-atomix}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{atomix}}.volumeMounts.name={{user-config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-freeradius}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{radius}}.volumeMounts.name={{freeradius-config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-atomix}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{atomix}}.volumeMounts.name={{system-config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-zookeeper}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{zookeeper}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-zookeeper}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{zookeeper}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kafka}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kafka}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kafka}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kafka}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-etcd-defrag.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-etcd-defrag.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-etcd-defrag.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-etcd-defrag.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments
Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-atomix-pdb}}.apiVersion of PodDisruptionBudget  is deprecated and is {{policy/v1beta1}}
